page.title: 03The Environment,Marton.
page.content: This rural area which lies between 90 and 100 metres above sea level is largely covered by corn crops.Most farmers grow these for sale or as cattle feed.Within the area there are many different herds of cattle.We have seen shorthorn,limousin and cross bred beef herds.The cattle graze freely on the grasslands but during some of the growing season areas of grass are fertilised and growth is encouraged for use as silage and hay.Through the area runs the main A423 which carries heavy traffic between Coventry and Southam.Along this road lies the village of Marton which has become a dormitary residential area for the surrounding towns.
